main event: On 16 February 1961, a civilian observed a reflective light in the sky over San Angelo, Texas.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 15 minutes.,The object was reported to be moving from south to north at about 20-25 feet above the horizon.,The observer noted that the object displayed reflections and was possibly a satellite.,There were no discernible maneuvers performed by the object.,The observer, a petroleum geologist, was deemed reliable and provided accurate information about the phenomenon.
